required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on February 08, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: RT-PCR SARS-CoV-2 at 1 Month of COVID-19 Infection in the Geriatric Population
clinical_study.official_title: RT-PCR SARS-CoV-2 at 1 Month of COVID-19 Infection in the Geriatric Population

brief_summary.textblock:
Evaluation of the rate of positive RT-PCR SARS-CoV-2 test at 1 month of COVID infection among elderly people.
It is unclear how long an individual with COVID-19 will remain "sick" and "contagious". It appears that SARS-CoV-2 can be transmitted before symptoms appear and throughout the course of the disease.
They investigators did not find any study on a COVID + geriatric population reassessing carriage at 1 month even though age seems to be a risk factor for prolonged excretion as suggested in the study following study: Xu K, Chen Y, Yuan J, Yi P, Ding C, Wu W, et al. Factors associated with prolonged viral RNA shedding in patients with COVID-19. Clinical Infectious Diseases. 2020 Apr 9; ciaa351

primary_outcome.measure: 1. Analysis of the rate of RT-PCR SARS-CoV-2 positive at 1 month of COVID infection
2. Assess quantitative evaluation of a nasopharyngeal swab SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test
primary_outcome.description: The objective of this study is to quantitatively assess viral shedding in COVID-19 infected elderly patients who survived infection in order to provide an overview of the evolution of nasopharyngeal swab SARS-CoV-2 real-time reverse transcriptase-polymerase chain reaction (RT-PCR) test results with the Cycle threshold value of the RT-PCR test.. The investigatrors analyze nasopharyngeal RT-PCR at diagnosis. After one month since the date of onset symptoms they reassessed survival patients with nasopharyngeal RT-PCR and repeat the RT-PCR at least every week until final negative conversion occurs.

secondary_outcome.measure: Assessment of late stool SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR, serological status and associated factors with death and RT-PCR results 1 month after the date of first symptom onset
secondary_outcome.time_frame: 1 month after the date of first symptom onset
secondary_outcome.description: Assessment of late stool SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR results one month after the date of onset symptom(dso) (% of patients with a positive fecal RT-PCR test after 1 month) COVID-19 serological status; associated factors with death and RT-PCR results 1 month after the dso: Age (year), gender, Medical history prior to hospilization : Hypertension, diabetes, coronary artery disease, heart failure, atrial fibrillation, chronic respiratory disease, History of medication: ACEI, ARBs Antiplatetet drug, doses of anticoagulant therapy, antibiotic, corticotherapy, statin, Proton pump inhibitor, T°C>37.8 7 days after the onset of symptoms, weight in kg, height in meter combined to report BMI in kg/m^2, Charlson score, Use of adjuvant oxygen, Lung CT-Scan results : extent of lesion <25%/25-50%/50-75%/>75%, Lymphocytes, platelet, CRP count at the time of diagnosis and 7 days after, GFR at diagnosis ml/min /1.73m2, ABO group, Rhesus antibody, Nasopharyngeal RT PCR initial Cycle Threshold

study_pop.textblock: Patient over 70 years age having COVID-19

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Age> 70years
- Patient hospitalized on the geriatric center from March 1, 2020 to August 1, 2020 with a diagnosis of COVID-19 still alive at 1 month.
- Patient having agreed to the re-use of their data for the purposes of this research
Exclusion Criteria:
- Subject who expressed his opposition to participate in the study
- Subject under judicial protection
